image.altText: A person pasting a love heart on a poster with the faces of hostages on it.

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump unilaterally declares that phase two of the Gaza ceasefire has begun, noting most of the remaining dead hostages have not been returned.

title.children: Ceasefire tested as more hostage remains released and Trump says Hamas must disarm

image.altText: Donald Trump standing in front of a wall with summit logos with his arms wide open

props.synopsis: Instead of thanking the US president, perhaps people should be asking: why are the hostages only coming home now?

title.children: Should Donald Trump be thanked for the Gaza ceasefire and hostage releases?

image.altText: Casey-Lee Peters looks into the camera, a bandage covers a port on her chest. There are framed photos in the background.

props.synopsis: A terminal cancer patient is told her failure to declare a UTI has voided her insurance policies, leaving her struggling to pay her mortgage and care for her children in her final days.

title.children: Dying mother loses life insurance after failing to declare UTI tests

image.altText: A woman wearing glasses, a light-coloured blouse and dark blazer smiles while posing for a photo in front of a leafy backdrop.

props.synopsis: Queensland's Crisafulli government is embroiled in a new "jobs for mates" claim after it appointed a Liberal National Party powerbroker to oversee the state's lead agency for disaster recovery.

title.children: New 'jobs for mates' claim over LNP government appointment

image.altText: Stephen Flelli sits at a table with a drink in his hand.

props.synopsis: After vanishing without a trace, this restaurateur reappeared a year later spruiking a shiny new investment opportunity. But there's just one problem.

title.children: This chef vanished after his debt-riddled companies failed. We tracked him down

image.altText: Two people on a beach with a large mass of fishing nets in front of them.

props.synopsis: Illegal fishing is ravaging the world's oceans of fish and shellfish but it is what is left behind that is creating a mess for governments worldwide and of Australia's most remote beaches.

title.children: The ocean's least natural predator has come for Australia

image.altText: Close up of man in white shirt and dark glasses (Darren Woolley).

props.synopsis: Darren Woolley spent years sharing his expert knowledge of marketing on the web for free. Almost overnight, the world mostly stopped listening to businesses like his.

title.children: 'It's pretty brutal': Inside the businesses being strangled by AI search

image.altText: Triple zero number about to be called on a mobile phone.

props.synopsis: Victoria's triple-0 dispatch software fails due to a power outage, forcing operators to take notes with pen and paper.

title.children: Software failure during power outage affects Victoria's triple-0 response

image.altText: Aboriginal flag at Parramatta deaths in custody rally

props.synopsis: State Coroner Teresa O'Sullivan has made rare public comments to raise what she calls the "entrenched over-representation" of Indigenous prisoners.

title.children: NSW coroner makes rare comment on 'distressing' Indigenous deaths in custody

image.altText: Jason Clare July 23

props.synopsis: Federal, state and territory education ministers will consider a proposal for a new national anti-bullying standard when they meet on Friday. Follow live.

title.children: Education ministers to consider national standards to combat bullying

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Rushing policies risks repeating mistakes of Dutton era: Paterson
Apologies are not going to win votes: Paterson
Education ministers to consider national standards to combat bullying

image.altText: A person holding a mobile phone surrounded by icons from social media platforms

props.synopsis: An emotional plea to the country, concerns about privacy and how Australia's social media ban will actually work. These are the key takeaways from the ABC's Your Say: The Digital Dilemma forum.

title.children: Five takeaways from the ABC's Your Say: The Digital Dilemma forum

image.altText: Sam Groth and his wife Brittany, who is smiling, at an election party

props.synopsis: The Herald Sun newspaper has defended its reporting about deputy leader of the Victorian Liberal Party Sam Groth and his wife as it prepares for a defamation lawsuit in the Federal Court.

title.children: Herald Sun says stories about Liberal MP Sam Groth and wife were in 'public interest'

image.altText: People's hands holding phones in front of a colourful social media logo.

props.synopsis: Teenagers on Instagram will be restricted to seeing PG-13 content by default and won't be able to change their settings without a parent's permission, Meta has announced.

title.children: Instagram to limit teens to PG-13 content, Meta says

image.altText: James Paterson looks serious past the camera.

props.synopsis: In a major address to his party, James Paterson says "marginal" voices agitating for the Liberal party to split must be kept on the sidelines, cautioning it would spell "disaster".

title.children: Senior conservative cautions Liberals quietly pushing to split the party

image.altText: Treasurer Jim Chalmers speaks to media during a press conference.

props.synopsis: After two years of refusing to reshape his superannuation shake-up, the treasurer abandons the idea of taxing unrealised gains while agreeing to index a key tax threshold.

title.children: An embarrassing backflip by Chalmers on super or a strategic shift?

image.altText: A multi-legged, black drone mid-flight in front of a blurry helicopter silhouette

props.synopsis: Peaceful European NATO nations that support Ukraine are repeatedly being targeted by mysterious drone incursions, and experts say dozens in the past month appear to have links to Russia.

title.children: A shadow drone war is being waged in Europe and many blame Russia

image.altText: People wave the Madagascar flag from a pickup truck driving through a crowd.

props.synopsis: The country's parliament voted to impeach President Andry Rajoelina after he fled the country in the face of growing opposition from soldiers and police.

title.children: Military announces takeover of Madagascar after president flees

image.altText: A red petrol station sign shows prices for ULP at 229.9 cents per litre, sunset in the distance

props.synopsis: Industry experts say there is no excuse for wild variations in fuel prices across Australia, as calls grow for an independent investigation into the disparity.

title.children: 'Doesn't pass the pub test': Why is fuel so expensive in some parts of Australia?

image.altText: A man in a dark, broad-brimmed hat sings into a microphone.

props.synopsis: The Untitled (How Does It Feel) singer died after a long struggle with cancer, his family said.

title.children: Grammy-winning R&B singer D'Angelo dies aged 51

image.altText: A woman standing outside a police station, wearing a stern expression.

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory government has doubled down on its stance against detaining trans women in female prisons, as a local LGBTQIA+ group says it is "horrified" by the comments.

title.children: Advocates condemn NT leader's comments on trans women in female prisons

image.altText: Drone shot of eleven fuel tanks next to harbour

props.synopsis: Groundwater is leaking through the safety liner under some of the fuel facility's 11 tanks, which were constructed unlawfully on Darwin Harbour without a building permit. It comes after the NT government approved the tanks for operation in September.

title.children: Safety liner under US military fuel tanks still failing, weeks after approval

image.altText: An infrared camera pointed at Return to Glenrowan by Sidney Nolan from his Ned Kelly Collection.

props.synopsis: Hidden figures and inscriptions are being discovered beneath some of Australia's most famous paintings as conservators use infrared technology to reveal details in Sidney Nolan's Ned Kelly series, unseen since the artist's own time.

title.children: Forensic imaging reveals hidden layers under Ned Kelly paintings

image.altText: The ASX building exterior.

props.synopsis: The Australian share market is expected to rise in morning trade despite a volatile session on Wall Street that has ended mostly lower. It follows Donald Trump ramping up trade tensions by saying he will consider "terminating business with China having to do with cooking oil". Follow live.

title.children: ASX likely to rise despite Trump's threat against China sending Wall St lower

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Petrol prices vary across Australia, but discrepancies of 50 cents per litre are prompting calls for an investigation
Businesses that rely on Google for customers see dramatic drop in traffic
Superannuation changes will end the 'ultimate tax shelter', says leading tax expert

image.altText: a man standing next to a busy road looks into the camera

props.synopsis: Taxi passengers living with a disability say they are unable to use subsidised transport because of a loophole in regulations.

title.children: 'Loophole' in taxi regulation leaves disabled passengers at the kerb

image.altText: A search in outback terrain.

props.synopsis: South Australia's police chief says renewed efforts in the search for the missing four-year-old will continue today and ahead of extreme heat tomorrow as investigators "seek to find answers regarding the disappearance of little Gus".

title.children: 'No stone unturned' as search for Gus continues in SA outback

image.altText: Pauline Hanson sipping from a beer at the launch party. An Australian flag hanging in the background.

props.synopsis: Polling has support for One Nation somewhere between 10 and 14 per cent, much higher than during the federal election.

title.children: Why has support for One Nation surged since the election, and will it last?

image.altText: A man smiles into the camera. A game demo can be seen on his computer in the background.

props.synopsis: Better known for its gas and iron ore, the Pilbara hopes to add gaming to its list of local exports as internet access and technology improve.

title.children: Regional developers cash in on the global gaming industry

image.altText: Infowars founder Alex Jones looking sideways, wearing a suit.

props.synopsis: The Infowars host claims the 2012 Sandy Hook Elementary School shooting, which claimed the lives of 20 first year students, was a hoax.

title.children: US Supreme Court upholds $2.1b ruling against conspiracy theorist Alex Jones

image.altText: A smiling man in a sports coat with an earpiece in.

props.synopsis: Stuart Broad lights the fuse ahead of the men's Ashes series, saying England has its best chance of winning in Australia since the 2010/11 series.

title.children: England great claims Aussies have 'worst' Ashes team in 15 years

image.altText: A Rugby League player cheers in triumph as he rises from making a try.

props.synopsis: Reece Walsh has built a compelling case for selection in the Kangaroos' starting line-up to face England, but coach Kevin Walters says he will not show favouritism towards the Maroons contingent in his squad.

title.children: No Queensland bias on Kangaroos' Ashes Tour, Walters says

image.altText: Aliyah Nasio and Julia Robinson involved in a brawl at the end of the NRLW grand final.

props.synopsis: The NRLW judiciary adds more pain to the Sydney Roosters' grand-final loss to the Brisbane Broncos, with forward Aliyah Nasio banned for four matches.

title.children: Rooster hit with record ban over NRLW final brawl

image.altText: A brochure reading 'algal bloom summer plan', with a picture of a beach.

props.synopsis: The full details of South Australia's algal bloom summer plan which aims to ensure South Australians can "enjoy their summer" were released yesterday. The plan includes measures to protect the state's coast while supporting businesses and communities.

title.children: Why does SA have a summer plan for the algal bloom and what's in it?
